title: How do you win a war?

What is the
view from
above?
description: In the months before D-Day, the Allied air forces conducted a dangerous but vital campaign to destroy the Nazi air forces and transportation system in France.
alt: Image of coast from the air

title:
How do you keep
the world's
biggest secret?
description: The location of the D-Day landings was the most important secret in the history of warfare. Before the D-Day invasion, the Allies devised a massive and daring deception to conceal the plan from the Nazis.

title:
How do you plan
an invasion?
description: Planning the D-Day invasion was a challenge unlike any other. Eisenhower and his commanders had to devise a plan to overcome the nearly impregnable Nazi defenses along the French coast. There would be no second chances.

title:
What brings
us together
to fight?
description: To achieve victory on D-Day, Eisenhower had to unify a coalition of nearly 2 million soldiers, sailors, and airmen from a dozen nations.

title:
How do you
prepare
for war?
description: Before Eisenhower commanded the D-Day invasion, he learned valuable lessons while commanding the Allied invasions of North Africa and Sicily.
